summary: DOD awards funds to biomedical researchers for projects on topics identified by Congress. The projects contribute to the development of new drugs, vaccines, and medical devices. DOD uses a cyclical, routine process to prioritize investments from these funds. In FYs 2015-19, it distributed nearly 100% of its $4.46 billion in funding. DOD coordinates with the Department of Veterans Affairs and the National Institutes of Health...
title: Biomedical Research: Observations on DOD's Management of Congressionally Directed Medical Research Programs
